metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7308 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernel before 4.20.6 performsundesirable out-of-bounds speculation on pointer arithmetic in variouscases, including cases of different branches with different state or limitsto sanitize, leading to side-channel attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-azure - 4.15.0-1041.45
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1029-gcp - 4.15.0-1029.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1035-aws - 4.15.0-1035.37~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1010-oracle - 4.15.0-1010.12~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.31~16.04.1').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.37~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1010.12~16.04.1').
